== Main Inclusion Report for soprano ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/s/soprano]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Build dependency of KDE 4, akonadi
 0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=soprano|no CVE entries]]</nowiki>: ...
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=soprano|no Secunia history]]</nowiki>: ...
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid. sopranod is the daemon
** No remote network activity, talks to apps over local network socket.
** It does process structured data
** No known source code review performed
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** The package always works out of the box without configuration
** The package asks no debconf questions
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:soprano|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>: None
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/s/soprano.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is calm
** <nowiki>[[http://soprano.sourceforge.net/|Upstream]]</nowiki> is busy
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.kde.org/buglist.cgi?product=nepomuk&bug_status=UNCONFIRMED&bug_status=NEW&bug_status=ASSIGNED&bug_status=REOPENED|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>: Only a few open
** Hardware: Does not deal with hardware
** There is not a test suite in the upstream source or packaging
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant
** Packaging system (cdbs)
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** Qt, cmake, librdf0-dev, libclucene-dev, doxygen, graphviz all in main
 0. ''Background information:''
** Upstream call it soprano and it is part of the nepomuk project
